Mewdeko Docs
Edit this page

Class SlashRoleStates

Provides slash commands for managing RoleStates in a guild. RoleStates allow the bot to save the roles of users when they leave the server and automatically reassign those roles if they rejoin.

Namespace: Mewdeko.Modules.RoleStates
Assembly: Mewdeko.dll
Syntax
[Group("rolestates", "Manage roles for users when they leave and rejoin!")]
public class SlashRoleStates : MewdekoSlashModuleBase<RoleStatesService>, IInteractionModuleBase
Remarks

This feature is particularly useful for maintaining continuity in user permissions and roles across server leaves and rejoins. Commands in this module allow administrators to enable/disable the feature, manage settings, and manipulate role states for specific users.

Constructors

| Edit this page View Source

SlashRoleStates(BotConfigService, InteractiveService)

Provides slash commands for managing RoleStates in a guild. RoleStates allow the bot to save the roles of users when they leave the server and automatically reassign those roles if they rejoin.

Declaration
public SlashRoleStates(BotConfigService bss, InteractiveService interactivity)
Parameters
Type Name Description
BotConfigService bss
InteractiveService interactivity
Remarks

This feature is particularly useful for maintaining continuity in user permissions and roles across server leaves and rejoins. Commands in this module allow administrators to enable/disable the feature, manage settings, and manipulate role states for specific users.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

AddRolesToRoleState(IUser, IRole[])

Adds specific roles to a user's saved RoleState, including them in the set of roles to be automatically reapplied.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("add-to-rolestate", "Adds a role to a RoleState", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task AddRolesToRoleState(IUser user, IRole[] roles)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user
IRole[] roles
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command complements the role removal command, allowing administrators to ensure a user's RoleState accurately reflects the roles they should receive upon rejoining the server.

| Edit this page View Source

DeleteUserRoleState(IUser)

Deletes a user's RoleState, removing all saved roles and preventing any from being automatically reapplied upon rejoin.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("delete-role-state", "Deletes a users RoleState", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task DeleteUserRoleState(IUser user)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command is used to clear a user's RoleState entirely, useful in situations where a clean slate is desired, or the previously saved roles are no longer applicable.

RoleStatesRemoveDenyUser(IUser[])

Reincludes specific users, allowing their roles to be managed by RoleStates once again.

Parameters
Type Name Description

Returns
Type Description

Remarks

If a user no longer needs to be excluded from RoleStates, this command ensures their roles will be saved and restored upon leaving and rejoining the server.

SetUserRoleState(IUser, IRole[])

Manually sets a user's RoleState, specifying which roles should be saved and potentially restored.

Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user
IRole[] roles
Returns
Type Description

Remarks

This command allows administrators to manually adjust the roles included in a user's RoleState, overriding the automatic detection and saving process.

| Edit this page View Source

ToggleRoleStates()

Toggles the RoleStates feature on or off for the guild, allowing or preventing the bot from saving and restoring role states.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("toggle", "Toggle whether RoleStates are enabled", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ToggleRoleStates()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

When enabled, the bot tracks the roles of all users in the guild. If a user leaves and later rejoins the guild, their previously assigned roles are automatically reapplied, assuming they haven't been excluded from the feature. This command requires administrator permissions to use.

| Edit this page View Source

ToggleRoleStatesClearOnBan()

Toggles whether saved role states should be cleared when a user is banned from the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("toggle-clear-on-ban", "Toggle whether role states get cleared on ban", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ToggleRoleStatesClearOnBan()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Enabling this option ensures that users who are banned lose their saved roles, preventing their automatic reapplication should they be unbanned and rejoin the server. This command requires administrator permissions to use.

| Edit this page View Source

ToggleRoleStatesIgnoreBots()

Toggles whether Role States will ignore bots when saving and restoring roles.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("toggle-ignore-bots", "Toggle whether Role States will ignore bots", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ToggleRoleStatesIgnoreBots()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

If enabled, bot users will not have their roles saved or restored. This can help prevent clutter and maintain role integrity, especially in servers where bots may frequently join and leave. This command requires administrator permissions to use.

| Edit this page View Source

ViewRoleStatesSettings()

Adds specified roles to a user's saved RoleState, allowing those roles to be automatically reapplied if the user rejoins the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("viewsettings", "View the current settings for RoleStates", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ViewRoleStatesSettings()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command can be used to manually adjust the roles that should be restored to a user upon rejoining. It is useful for correcting or updating the roles that are saved in the user's RoleState. This command requires administrator permissions to use.

| Edit this page View Source

ViewUserRoleStates()

Lists all users in the server with saved RoleStates, showing the roles that will be automatically reapplied upon rejoin.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("viewstates", "Let's you view all active RoleStates for every user!", false, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ViewUserRoleStates()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Use this command to audit the saved role states across all users, ensuring accuracy and relevancy of roles that are set to be restored.
